intro: Centaurea avarica, commonly known as the slender centaury, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and has slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Centaurea avarica is often found in open habitats such as fields and coastal areas, where it thrives in full sun.
